narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Amrutasri Ashwini Nori-Sarma  Amruta was a very engaged, accessible, and knowledgeable TA. She made sure to be in touch with students when guidance was needed.

Instructor: Amrutasri Ashwini Nori-Sarma  Strengths: She was very knowledgeable about the course. Had personal experiences to add to discussion and asked good questions to maintain conversations in class. Also very accessible via email. Weakness: none
Instructor: Amrutasri Ashwini Nori-Sarma  Very knowledgable, engaging, helpful, and responsive! She was a great help for me personally.
Instructor: Amrutasri Ashwini Nori-Sarma  Amruta is well-informed and good at communicating.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: BEST CLASS OFFERED AT YALE
I'm so glad I took this course as it was one of my first in ethics. even though it was a very short period of time I feel like I learned so much.

It is an interesting course to start thinking in issues that maybe you are not aware of. However I think that for people that is really involved in these topics, and as for many students at FES, there is a close connection and awareness on the Ethical problems. There is space in the course to talk about more difficult topics related with environmental ethics, beyond "obvious" problems. It would be interesting to show different views, how our own parameters of ethics could be "wrong" or denying valid points made by other groups that are "against" the environmental values that people at FES hold.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Great opportunity to engage with ethical concepts important to all environmental fields. Diversity of materials and topics was helpful for working through these concepts, and for drawing in students from different disciplines into discussion with one another.

The hybrid online course was my favorite part. This allowed students like me to be able to take the time to come up with insightful comments about discussion questions posed online. So instead of having to read everything the night before, which often students don't do, we were able to take a week to read and answer. Better for learning. Made me more interested in the subject.
In class discussion that allowed all the students/instructors to communicate and share ideas.
A lot of space to discuss. Variety of topics.

So many! The lectures were great and interesting, I particualrly liked the curated lectures from other sources (e.g., NAACP and EPA) that I otherwise wouldn't have watched. This class has sparked my curiositiy and given me a foundation to build upon when thinking about human-environment interactions.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Perhaps going into some greater depth in some of the subjects. It was a broad overview of ethical issues and I feel like we didn't go into enough depth on some issues.

One hour is far too short to properly delve into the material in a meaningful way. I would suggest perhaps making the in-class discussion 2 hours long and having a different set of students facilitate the discussion so there is a variety of discussion formats rather than just question and answer.
I think time management during class meetings is key. Felt that many times we were able to have discussion everything wasn't said. Also, with final presentations, one group talked for almost 20min.

This course was heavily tilted towards looking at environmental ethics as they related to science, and particularly health. I would say that I expected an environmental ethics course to spend more time reading and discussing more qualitative ethics-specific literature and environmental ethics movements (e.g. for deep ecology, reading Arne Naess and Gary Snyder, etc.).

As I comment before, within the variety of topics studied, different world-views showed as valid points could made the class more interesting, and could be helpful for the students to become more aware of the "real" world and the difference of views, that could have different and valid points, based in different values. - The videos are very interesting. I like the selection and pace of the interview videos. For the lecture videos, the pace may be slower to allow the students to hear and take notes.

This course was well managed, so it's hard to say! I'd love to see it be a full-semester course to allow deeper discussion about a wider range of issues. This is an important class and unfortunately unique at F&ES, as I think many FESers would benefit from this kind of instruction and thinking.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Having only a one-hour discussion meeting was effective. Longer courses tend to have trouble maintaining efficient use of discussion time. This course maintained very on point discussion.
N/A
I think this helped to think and talk about a specific topic before coming to class. Helped a lot and kept conversations short because we already knew what other students were thinking.

The lectures and discussions were well-tied together and well-done! My only comment is that the load of video watching some weeks was a little long... it's hard to sit through 2 hours of youtube videos.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Doesn't much fit into my program. But I was interested in the ethical considerations of decision making. I think as an aspiring health care manager it added to my thought process. Considering ethics not just the economic side of things.
This is an elective for me and one I enjoyed very much. It tied together some themes I'd discussed in other classes but hadn't had the chance to discuss with classmates and professors in depth.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I am interested in ethical system associated with sustainability problems.
I was interested in learning more about the environment
Seemed interesting from the description
i care about environmental health and science. i thought it would be beneficial to also learn about environmental ethics.

The topic is very interesting for me. How to manage different views and how to use the ethical discourse, in a context where Economics and Science are the main arguments, is a fascinating topic for me.
To delve deeper into the humanistic dimensions of the environment and health, and to gain a framework to better contextualize my studies and work at F&ES.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Exceeded my expectations.
I had no expectations but what I got from the class was very informative and interesting.
Yes, definitely. This course provided a platform to think and talk about important issues that I think are under-represented at F&ES.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Best working group in my academic career

Advantages were that we all came from different disciplines and had to work to find a topic at the nexus of all our interests. Disadvantages of this work was that - as with all group work - some members were more dedicated to completing work and committing time than others.
advantages: working with people from different programs (FES/MArch/MPH) no disadvantages.
Given the different backgrounds of my group members we had a great discussion and were able to incorporate
The time to organize the meetings was to short. This activity could have be done earlier in the semester and/or the groups could be created before.
The group presentation was good, but we could have used a little more guidance and focus. It seemed like we had to stretch ourselves thin to cover each of the subject areas using our case study.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: interesting course. and not just for people who are interested in environmental issues. many of the ethical considerations discussed are transferrable to other fields.
Do the readings and be prepared to in class discussion or else the classroom component may be boring.

The workload is very reasonable and the topics are very interesting. I would highly recommend this course to any student interested in exploring the relationships that exist between humans when it comes to the environment and health.
